text:
="preserve">Cobalt(II) oxide, also known as cobaltous oxide, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is CoO. It contains cobalt in its +2 oxidation state as an ion. It also contains oxide. It can be green or red crystals. It can also be a grey or brown powder.
Use.
It can react with acids to make salts containing cobalt. It is used to make blue glass.
